content.description:
Begin with left foot on small flake and both hands matching the apparent shelf. The first move is the crux; if matched: v2. If crimps and flakes above shelf are used as starting holds; v0. Mantel onto the next shelf. Top out, but be wary of the chossy top.

To the right of the huge boulder on the left of the "Provincial Park" sign at park entrance. Not even a one minute walk from pull out at entrance. Closest boulder in proximity to fence that runs along boulder patch.
2-3 pads optimal. 1 pad essential.

climbs.name: Untitled, Unknown.
climbs.fa: Unknown. However ranked as v3 on forum.

content.description:
Starting move is very comfy. Begins with matched side pull on obvious chalked holds. After this reach for the tiny crimp on a crack and heel hook. Then mantel and topout. Be careful of the choss on top.

Apparently huge boulder to the left of the provincial parks sign at park entrance. Walk to the right of the boulder (not onto the private property!) and down and around.Â 
2-5 pads. Spotters.

On middle of face; match on bottom "half crescent moon"; side pulls to left; middle height right gaston; slopey arete finish; mantle to top. V1 if flake is used on left. v2+ if only slopers and arete are used.

Directly to the left of "Truck Stop."
1-3 pads. Spotters.

Mainly located around the Montague Harbour area, Galiano Island has a plentiful amount of boulders and even some crags that have yet to be explored. With only two known first accents as of 2019 there is plenty of potential for those keen to get their names in the annals of climbing history.
